Circos plot of signaling score

SigPlot.Rd

Produce a plot of a cell signaling network according to the cell-normalized expression score.

SigPlot(P, rgb_gap = 0.2, cluster_labels, lig_cells_per_cluster = 10,
  rec_cells_per_cluster = 10, zero_threshold = 0, cD_reduce = 0,
  highlight_clusters = TRUE, title_text = NULL, n_clusters = NULL,
  n_cluster_cols = NULL, receptor_chord_color = FALSE)

Arguments

P

signaling probabilities cells x cells
rgb_gap

real percent of the inter-cluster spectrum gap to encompass cluster highlighting
cluster_labels

labels of cells ordered from 1 to n
lig_cells_per_cluster

int 0 to keep all
rec_cells_per_cluster

int 0 to keep all
zero_threshold

real value for zero cutoff (0 to keep all edges)
cD_reduce

ratio of the circlos plot grid element (cell or cluster) to the whole circle is less than this value, the item is omitted from the plot. Default is zero, don't change unless you are inspecting an unhighlighted chord diagram, since it breaks highlighting if one or more pairs above the zero_threshold happen to have a low grid/circle ratio.
highlight_clusters

whether to label the plot with clusters. Default is true.
title_text

the title of the plot
n_clusters

if n is higher than the number of unique labels (colorscale can be used for meta plotting)
n_cluster_cols

for plots with different subpopulations, use this to reserve dropout clusters in individual plots. WARNING: this is strongly recommended if there are dropouts, ie unique(labels) != 1:length(labels)
receptor_chord_color

color the chords according to the receptor-bearing cell they point to. default is false

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by Matt Karikomi, Shuxiong Wang, Adam MacLean.
